TopicTitle: KSP Twitter- "We've got something planned later today"

Articles.Content: My gut feeling says "community contest", like building something onto/around an asteroid and/or taking it along for crazy missions.

> 
> My gut feeling says "community contest", like building something onto/around an asteroid and/or taking it along for crazy missions.

Probably a Reddit challenge then. Might it be Forum vs Reddit like the Kerbin Cup thing?

So far, I've been a touch disappointed with these "Ooooh shiny!" baits. The last one was the PS4 announcement. 

What it turns out to be, it's almost certainly not actual game content.

It's either: 

"A giant asteroid wiped out all 947 (including ~70 high/critical priority and >700 legacy) bugs in the [KSP bugtracker](https://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/3bm5gn/ksp_on_twitter_weve_got_something_planned_later/). This asteroid has impacted your Kerbal store/steam account -> download now!\*"

Or:

"Asteroid impacts (and missions) in KSP..."

Fingers crossed for the first one!

\*COG users will get it too... eventually

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-30T16:12:12Z" title="06/30/2015 04:12  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 30, 2015</time> by Yakuzi**

> 
> Uhm, Rosetta and Philae went to a comet, not an asteroid. Asteroid day is for raising awareness about the fact a giant rock could smack into us anytime it wants to.

As if you would feel the difference between an asteroid strike and a comet strike. Comets usually travel a lot faster. A comet strike could therefore be that much bigger.

> 
> Top suggestion on reddit is [3D printable asteroids ($49.99)](http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/3bm5gn/ksp_on_twitter_weve_got_something_planned_later/). Considering how well the previous 'get hyped!' announcements went, this should be interesting.

Lol, that would be too funny.
Kerbin gets hit with an asteroid and now you can only fly vessels that have already been launched?

> 
> Kerbin gets hit with an asteroid and now you can only fly vessels that have already been launched?

Very interesting scenario.

> 
> As if you would feel the difference between an asteroid strike and a comet strike. Comets usually travel a lot faster. A comet strike could therefore be that much bigger.

Not just "that much bigger", but "that much bigger" **squared**. The impact energy is proportional to the **square** of velocity -- so something traveling twice as fast delivers four times the impact.

Not to mention that a long-period comet -- the fastest-traveling ones -- would give us much less warning than a nearby asteroid that we can track for years. Add to that the possibility that the Kreutz family of comets is more typical than we think, and comets are clearly the much bigger threat on a per-impact basis. (The Kreutz family are a series of comets which we learned a lot more about thanks to SOHO that are thought to have originated from a single parent comet, perhaps 100 km across.)

The concept of impactor diversion fascinates me. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Not just because it's so exotic, but because it's one of the only natural disasters we can do something about with modern technology (besides get out of the way).

clarified SOHO's role in Kreutz comet discovery

Ok, hype wore off.

Yeah, it's probably some PR stuff that Squad will be pulling for Asteroid Day, nothing ingame.

> 
> Should we begin the Hype?

Given the last couple of announcements we should have a Disappointment Train instead.

It's a part pack with a probe with SAS, a bigger fixed solar panel, a dish antenna and an asteroid telescope. It contains also a mission pack. It's on Curse already...

[http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/232196-asteroid-day](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/232196-asteroid-day)

- - - Updated - - -

Me, I've been disappointed at every other major annoucement. Plushies? 3D prints? PS4? Smoke on the launchpad? Okay, that last one I actually enjoy. Which shows how much I care for the rest.

Yay! [Kasper's "oops" moment on the 6-26 SQ](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126878-Squadcast-Summary-6-26-15) is now revealed. The parts he was playing with were not from a random mod, but *(cough)* some of the actual parts from this special event tie-in! Squad has, I think, succeeded this time, in under-promising and over-delivering!

> 
> It's a part pack with a probe with SAS, a bigger fixed solar panel, a dish antenna and an asteroid telescope. It contains also a mission pack. It's on Curse already...
> [http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/232196-asteroid-day](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/232196-asteroid-day)

Assuming it's licensed like the World Cup pack was, can anyone download it and put it up on their dropbox? I will not touch Curse again with a 10' pole.
